intro: Cicer luteum, commonly known as the yellow vetch, is a flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky soils. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers in clusters. Its seed pods are typically hairy and contain several elliptical seeds. Cicer luteum is valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it useful in agricultural settings.
